Instrument.name: Alpha Proton X-Ray Spectrometer
Instrument.description: The Mars Pathfinder Rover Alpha Proton X-ray Spectrometer (APXS) is designed to measure the elemental chemistry of martian surface material to help gain a more detailed understanding of the geologic and geochemical processes taking place within Mars and on the surface and to allow inferences as to the role played by reactions with the atmosphere and water. The instrument consists of a sensor head which is placed against a sample by a deployment mechanism mounted on the rover chassis. The sensor head was placed on a sample (rock or soil) for a period of 10 hours. It would then be moved to a different sample for another measurement. A color imager mounted on the back of the rover took pictures of all the samples studied.
